content.title: YSR Law Nestham
content.details: Being implemented since December 2019, the scheme 'YSR Law Nestham' by the Law Department, Govt. of Andhra Pradesh provides a monthly stipend of an amount of ₹ 5,000/- to the Junior Advocates. The applicant should be in the rolls of Advocates being maintained by the Andhra Pradesh State Bar Council under Section 17 of the Advocates Act, 1961. Only the Law Graduates, who passed out in the year 2016 and afterward are only eligible.
benefits: A monthly stipend of an amount of ₹ 5,000/- for the first three years.
eligibility: The applicant should be a resident/domicile of the state of Andhra Pradesh.
The applicant shall possess Bachelor's Degree in Law.
The applicant should be a Law Graduate, who passed out in the year 2016 and afterward.
The name of the applicant shall be entered in the rolls of Advocates being maintained by the Andhra Pradesh State Bar Council under Section 17 of the Advocates Act, 1961.

The Junior Advocates, who started practice and have not crossed the first three (3) years of practice, as of the date of issue of the Government Order, are eligible for a stipend for the remaining period.
The Junior Advocate shall not exceed Thirty-Five (35) years as of the date of issue of the Government Order.
This is a 'One Family, One Benefit' scheme ('Family' means Husband, Wife, and their Children).
exclusions: The Junior Advocates, who have crossed the first three (3) years of practice, as of the date of issue of the G.O., are not eligible.
The Applicant possessing four-wheelers in his name is not eligible.
A Non-Practicing Advocates are not eligible.
documents_required: Marksheet / Passing Certificate of Bachelor's Degree in Law
Proof of Age / Date of Birth

An affidavit attested by his/her Senior Advocate with 15 years of standing of practice or Concerned Bar Association or by the presiding officer of such court, every six months, stating that he/she is still in active practice.
Certificate of practice after clearing the Bar examination conducted by the Bar Council of India within two (2) years. (to be submitted after enrolment into the scheme)
Undertaking that he/she will intimate online or to the registering authority, in case he/she leaves the Profession or otherwise he/she gainfully employed.

faqs.question: What Is The Maximum Amount Of Financial Assistance That One Can Receive Through This Scheme?
faqs.answer: The beneficiary shall be eligible for a monthly stipend of an amount of ₹ 5,000/- for the first three years.

faqs.question: What Shall Be The Duration Of The Stipend?
faqs.answer: The duration of the stipend shall be three years.

faqs.question: Which Department Manages This Scheme?
faqs.answer: This scheme is managed by the Law Department, Govt. of Andhra Pradesh.

faqs.question: Is It Mandatory For The Applicant To Be In The Rolls Of Advocates Being Maintained By The Andhra Pradesh State Bar Council?
faqs.answer: Yes, in order to be eligible for this scheme, the applicant should be in the roles of Advocates being maintained by the Andhra Pradesh State Bar Council under Section 17 of the Advocates Act, 1961.

faqs.question: Who Can Apply To This Scheme?
faqs.answer: Only Law Graduates, who passed out in the year 2016 and afterward can apply to this scheme.

faqs.question: Can I Apply To This Scheme If I've Graduated In The Year 2019?
faqs.answer: Yes, you are eligible to apply.

faqs.question: How Many Members Of The Same Family Can Apply To This Scheme?
faqs.answer: This is a 'One Family, One Benefit' scheme ('Family' means Husband, Wife, and their Children). Only one member of the same family can apply to this scheme.

faqs.question: Are There Any Age-Related Criteria For This Scheme?
faqs.answer: Yes, the Junior Advocate shall not exceed Thirty-Five (35) years as of the date of issue of the Government Order.

faqs.question: How Much Shall The Amount Of Stipend Be In The Case Of Junior Advocates, Who Have Not Crossed The First Three (3) Years Of Practice?
faqs.answer: The Junior Advocates, who started practice and have not crossed the first three (3) years of practice, as of the date of issue of the Government Order, are eligible for a stipend for the remaining period.

faqs.question: Can A Domicile Of Telangana Also Apply To This Scheme?
faqs.answer: No, in order to be eligible to apply, the applicant should be a resident/domicile of the state of Andhra Pradesh.

faqs.question: How Will The Amount Of Financial Assistance Be Disbursed To The Eligible Beneficiaries?
faqs.answer: The amount is credited into the bank account of the beneficiary. The Village /Ward volunteer will door deliver the 'payment receipt' and message of the Hon’ble Chief Minister to the beneficiary.

faqs.question: Is This Scheme State Sponsored Or Centrally Sponsored?
faqs.answer: This scheme is a 100% State Sponsored Scheme.

faqs.question: Does This Scheme Accept Offline Applications?
faqs.answer: No, this scheme only accepts online applications.

faqs.question: Is There Any Application Fee?
faqs.answer: No. The entire application process is completely free of cost.

faqs.question: Is There A Percentage Of Slots Reserved For Female Applicants?
faqs.answer: No, there is no reservation of slots based on the gender of the applicant.

faqs.question: Since When Is This Scheme Under Implementation?
faqs.answer: This scheme under implementation since December 2019.
